newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Taiwan money rates close lower, further slide seen.
newsitem.headline: Taiwan money rates close lower, further slide seen.

text.p: Taiwan's money rates ended lower on Friday as the maturation of T$8 billion in negotiable certificates of deposit flushed the banking system with funds, dealers said.

The overnight interbank rate closed at 6.628 percent against Thursday's 6.821 close -- still far outside the central bank's 5.00-5.5 percent target zone -- with 30-day commercial paper at 6.70 percent against 6.75.
Dealers expected the money rates to fall further next week as the central bank was unlikely to issue NCDs to mop up liquidity amid the stock market's current corrections.
Despite the central bank's repeated denials, many analysts have asserted that the bank's near-continuous recent issuance of NCDs aimed to dampen sizzling stock market turnover.
Sentiment was quiet in the bond market. The benchmark 10-year 86/4 government bond yields were traded at 6.0805-0820 percent in earlier session.
Bond dealers said stock market performance and short-term interest rates movement would determine the level of bond yields next week.
